item.value: By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billion telephone lines in the world.
The elephant is distinguished by its high level of intelligence, interesting behavior, methods of communication and complex social structure.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan. Thomas Edison improved on Swan's design by using a better incandescent material and a higher vacuum.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
The strongest wind ever recorded wind was on Mt Washington, New Hampshire, USA. It was an amazing 231mph.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
In 1932 Amelia Earhart became the first woman to do a solo transatlantic flight. She flew from Harbor Grace, Newfoundland, to Ireland in approximately 15 hr.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
A shark can hear a fish in the water from more than a mile away.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
Mount McKinley in Alaska in the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
China has the largest population of any country. It has over 1.3 billion people.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
